about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should:

about.name: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should:

hasPart.assesses: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should: | A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When encountering a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should slow down and proceed with caution. You do not need to come to a complete stop when approaching a flashing yellow light.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

comment.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

suggestedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop as quickly as possible.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop as quickly as possible.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop and proceed only when the intersection is clear.

comment.text: Stop and proceed only when the intersection is clear.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

comment.text: Slow down and proceed with caution.

answerExplanation.text: When encountering a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should slow down and proceed with caution. You do not need to come to a complete stop when approaching a flashing yellow light.

comment.text: A flashing yellow light at an intersection means you should: | When encountering a flashing yellow light at an intersection, you should slow down and proceed with caution. You do not need to come to a complete stop when approaching a flashing yellow light.

hasPart.name: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:

about.name: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle:

hasPart.assesses: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle: | You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

suggestedAnswer.text: If the vehicle ahead is turning left.

comment.text: If the vehicle ahead is turning left.

suggestedAnswer.text: If there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction.

comment.text: If there are two or more lanes traveling in your direction.
Under no circumstances.
Under no circumstances.

answerExplanation.text: You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

comment.text: You can drive off the road to pass another vehicle: | You may never drive off the paved or main-traveled portion of the road and onto the shoulder to pass another vehicle.

hasPart.name: If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and:

about.name: If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and:

hasPart.assesses: If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and: | If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When parking uphill on a road that does not have a curb, your front wheels should be turned to the right (toward the edge of the road). This will ensure that the vehicle will roll off of the road if the brakes fail.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.

comment.text: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: Turn your wheels away from the edge of the road.

comment.text: Turn your wheels away from the edge of the road.
Keep your wheels facing straight.

acceptedAnswer.text: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.

comment.text: Turn your wheels toward the edge of the road.

answerExplanation.text: When parking uphill on a road that does not have a curb, your front wheels should be turned to the right (toward the edge of the road). This will ensure that the vehicle will roll off of the road if the brakes fail.

comment.text: If you park facing uphill where there is no curb, set the parking brake and: | When parking uphill on a road that does not have a curb, your front wheels should be turned to the right (toward the edge of the road). This will ensure that the vehicle will roll off of the road if the brakes fail.

hasPart.name: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:

about.name: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must:

hasPart.assesses: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must: | When you approach an octagonal sign, you must: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

comment.text: Slow.
Stop.
Turn.
Stop.

answerExplanation.text: An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

comment.text: When you approach an octagonal sign, you must: | An octagonal (eight-sided) sign always means "Stop." Come to a complete stop, yield to traffic and pedestrians that have the right-of-way, and proceed when the way is clear.

hasPart.name: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

about.name: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes? | Which of these statements is true about changing lanes? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

comment.text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

comment.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

suggestedAnswer.text: Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

comment.text: Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

acceptedAnswer.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

comment.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

answerExplanation.text: Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

comment.text: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes? | Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

hasPart.name: This white sign means you:
hasPart.assesses: This white sign means you: | This white sign means you: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A sign that says to "yield" means that you must slow down and be ready to stop to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. After yielding, you may follow the remaining directions on the sign.

suggestedAnswer.text: May turn left only on a green arrow.

comment.text: May turn left only on a green arrow.

suggestedAnswer.text: May turn left on a green light when it is safe.

comment.text: May turn left on a green light when it is safe.

suggestedAnswer.text: Must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

comment.text: Must wait for the solid green light before you turn left.

acceptedAnswer.text: May turn left on a green light when it is safe.

comment.text: May turn left on a green light when it is safe.

answerExplanation.text: A sign that says to "yield" means that you must slow down and be ready to stop to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. After yielding, you may follow the remaining directions on the sign.

comment.text: This white sign means you: | A sign that says to "yield" means that you must slow down and be ready to stop to let any vehicle, bicyclist, or pedestrian pass before you proceed. After yielding, you may follow the remaining directions on the sign.
